code.value:
from langflow.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from langflow.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from langflow.inputs import BoolInput
from langflow.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from langflow.memory import store_message
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from langflow.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from langflow.inputs import BoolInput
from langflow.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from langflow.memory import store_message
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

code.value:
from langflow.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from langflow.io import Output, PromptInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

template.name: template
template.value:
Retrieve data for the following user query: {query}

# Basic instructions
1. You have to generate a sql sentence and a small description in order to show all of the necessary data to give another ai to answer the same query
2. Be careful with null values and divisions by 0

# Schemas
Schemas definition for a postgresql database:
CREATE TYPE ORG_ID_TYPE AS ENUM ('MWC', 'MWF', 'MSW');
CREATE TYPE VALUE_TYPE AS ENUM ('REALIZED', 'ESTIMATED', 'FORECAST', 'BUDGETED');
CREATE TYPE QUARTER_TYPE AS ENUM ('Q1', 'Q2', 'Q3', 'Q4');

CREATE TABLE BUDGET6 (
	id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	year INT,           						-- eg. 2023
	quarter QUARTER_TYPE,       -- Null if it corresponds to the entire year     	
	category VARCHAR(128) NOT NULL,     		-- e.g., "Net Sales", "Gross Margin"
	parent_category VARCHAR(128),            	-- e.g., "Revenues Total", NULL for main categories
	value float8,                   	-- Financial values
	is_percentage BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,     	-- True for percentage rows
	value_type VALUE_TYPE DEFAULT 'REALIZED', -- 'REALIZED', 'ESTIMATED', 'FORECAST', 'BUDGETED'
	org_id ORG_ID_TYPE DEFAULT 'MWC'
);

# Guidelines
## Avaliable periods
2023, None, REALIZED
2024, "Q1", REALIZED
2024, "Q2", REALIZED
2024, "Q1", ESTIMATED
2024, "Q2", ESTIMATED
2024, "Q3", ESTIMATED
2024, None, ESTIMATED
2024, None, BUDGETED
2025, None, REALIZED
2025, None, BUDGETED
So including value_type will be necessary sometimes.

## Category distinct fields
Outsourced Employees Expenses Included in Personnel
Commercial GM%
Management Commission
Office Exp.& Maintenance
Expenses w/o Prov. Management &  Tax
Transport & Car repairs
Financial cost on lease liabilities
Non-Operating Revenues
Entertainment
Stock deterioration
Total Sales
Warranty and maintenance for BG
Hardware & Software Mainten.
Expenses / Revenues %
Net Income before provisions
Audit Fees
Tuition Fees
Top Up Tax (TUT)
Sundries
Consulting Fees & Commissions
Total Expenses
Sponsor Fees
Income Taxes (Including the TUT)
Vacation-Air Tickets
Participation Revenue
EBT
Foreigners Employees Included in Personnel
%GM
Accounting Charges
Sold Fixed Assets/Exceptional
Local Employees Included in Personnel
Transportation Allowance
Revenues Total
Attorney Fees
Training & Seminars
Apartments Allowances
After Sales Local
Expenses w/o Mgt & Tax Variation % between YOY
Expenses w/o Mgt & Tax/ GM %
Net Income / HC
Sales Local
Income Taxes
Localization
Total Administrative
Other Provision
Total Outsourcing
Management Fees
Telephone Telex Fax & Courier
Cost of Sales
Net Sales
Rent Office ,Warehouse & Cars/ Right of use
ITQAN Program Contribution to personnel Expenses (KSA)
Total Revenues / HC
Personnel Expenses
Commissions & Bonus
Other Allowance
Discounts covered by BDF Program
Gifts & Promotional Items
Legal Fees & Taxes (Incl. WHT)
Human Resources (Inc. local program Emp.)
Human Resources (Excl. local program Emp.)
Net Income in US$
Total Professional Services
Sub-Total Locals
Marketing Contribution
After Sales
Exchange Income
Bad Debts & Provisions
Financial Expenses
Expenses / GM %
ITQAN program Employees Included in Personnel (KSA)
Bonus & Commission / GM %
Impairment of Goodwill
Tools, Spare parts & Repair
Sales commission to other
Exceptional Loss
Outsourcing Local
Factoring
Certification
Subscription & Magazines
Operating & Administ. Expenses
Insurance Office & Cars
Medical Insurance
Net Income / Revenues %
Operating Revenues
Net Marketing
Freight Clearing & Customs
Head office expenses
HC Recharged by Affiliates
Outsourcing/Inside Sales
Administrative Local
EBIT
ECL for Banks
Sub-Total Foreigners
Exchange Expenses
Trading Portfolio Loss
Printing & Stationary
Gross Margin
Salaries
Penality Charges
End of Service Indemnity
Professional Services Local
Expenses w/o Prov. ,Mgt, tax & Outsourced included Personnel Exp
Advance Billing Provision
Electricity & Water
Sales
Financial Revenues & Cash Discount
Amortization & Depreciation
Tender fees
Outsourced Employees Expenses Allocated to COS
Total After Sales
Social Security
HC Recharged to Affiliates
Exhibition & Advertis.Expenses
Prof. Services
Administrative
Travel Expenses

From the list, the most relevant fields to extract conclusions usually are:
'Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$'
So extract them if asked.

# Examples
1. Query: "Give me the 24/B-24 ratio in percentage for 2024 for the business MWC"
Expected response:

sql: "SELECT 
	a.category, a.parent_category
    CASE
        WHEN b.value <> 0 THEN (a.value / b.value) * 100
        ELSE NULL
    END AS 24/B-24
FROM 
    budget6 a
JOIN 
    budget6 b
ON 
    a.categoryname = b.categoryname and a.quarterlabel is null and b.quarterlabel is null
WHERE 
    a.period = '2024' AND
    b.period = '2024' AND
    a.valuetype = 'ESTIMATED' AND
    b.valuetype = 'BUDGETED';"
short_description: "Estimated 2024/Budgeted 2024 ratio in percentage for MWC"
2. Query: "Give me for the most relevant values the B.2025 - Est2024 for MWC"
sql: "SELECT 
    a.category, 
    CASE
        WHEN b.value IS NOT NULL AND b.value <> 0 THEN (a.value - b.value)
        ELSE NULL
    END AS "B.2025 - Est2024"
FROM 
    budget6 a
JOIN 
    budget6 b
ON 
    a.category = b.category AND a.quarter IS NULL AND b.quarter IS NULL
WHERE 
    a.year = 2025 AND
    b.year = 2024 AND
    a.value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND
    b.value_type = 'ESTIMATED' AND
    a.org_id = 'MWC' AND
    b.org_id = 'MWC' AND
    a.category IN ('Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$');"
short_description: "B.2025 - Est2024 for key financial categories for MWC."
3. Query: "Give me only the relevant figures for the budget 2024 and budget 2025 and interpret them as a financial expert"
sql: SELECT year, category, parent_category, value, value_type FROM budget6 WHERE quarter is null and year IN (2024, 2025) AND value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND org_id = 'MWC' AND category IN ('Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$');
short_description: "Budgeted values for 2024 and 2025 for key categories for MWC"

3. Query: "Give me a breakdown of the Personnel expenses of budget 2024 in MWC"
sql: SELECT category, parent_category, value 
	FROM budget6 
	WHERE 
	year = 2024 AND 
	quarter IS NULL AND 
	value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND 
	org_id = 'MWC' 
	AND (category = 'Personnel Expenses' or parent_category = 'Personnel Expenses');
short_description: "Breakdown of Personnel Expenses for budget 2024 in MWC and Personnel Espenses Total"

from langflow.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from langflow.io import Output, PromptInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)

code.value:
from langflow.base.io.text import TextComponent
from langflow.io import MultilineInput, Output, DataInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
import psycopg2
from tabulate import tabulate  # For generating Markdown tables
from langflow.schema import Data
print("hi")
class TextInputComponent(Component):
    display_name = "SQL Retriever"
    description = "SQL Retriever"
    icon = "database"
    name = "SQL Retriever"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="host", display_name="Host"),
        MessageTextInput(name="user", display_name="User"),
        MessageTextInput(name="sql_query", display_name="SQL Query"),
        MessageTextInput(name="short_description", display_name="Short Description", value=""),
        SecretStrInput(name="password", display_name="Password"),
        MessageTextInput(name="database", display_name="Database"),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            connection = psycopg2.connect(
                host=self.host, # "dev-maind.cnkw2weg8a5t.eu-west-1.rds.amazonaws.com",
                user=self.user, # postgres
                password=self.password, # "maind|159074-{RDS}",
                database=self.database #Â "MIDIS"
            )
            cursor = connection.cursor()

            print(str(self.sql_query))
            # Execute the query
            cursor.execute(
                str(self.sql_query)
            )
            result = cursor.fetchall()
    
            # Dynamically fetch headers
            headers = [desc[0] for desc in cursor.description]
            print(headers)
    
            # Generate Markdown table
            markdown_table = tabulate(result, headers, tablefmt="pipe", disable_numparse=True)
    
            # Clean up resources
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()
            print(result)
            print(markdown_table)
            final_string = f"{str(self.short_description)}\n{markdown_table}"
            self.status = final_string
            return Message(text=final_string)
        except Exception as e:
            return Message(text="Error retrieving data")

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.info: The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return
code.name: code

json_mode.name: json_mode
json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed
seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.info: The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

from langflow.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from langflow.custom import Component
from langflow.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from langflow.io import Output, PromptInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
from langflow.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

template.name: template
template.value:
Retrieve data for the following user query: {query}

# Basic instructions
1. You have to generate a sql sentence and a small description in order to show all of the necessary data to give another ai to answer the same query
2. Be careful with null values and divisions by 0

# Schemas
Schemas definition for a postgresql database:
CREATE TYPE ORG_ID_TYPE AS ENUM ('MWC', 'MWF', 'MSW');
CREATE TYPE VALUE_TYPE AS ENUM ('REALIZED', 'ESTIMATED', 'FORECAST', 'BUDGETED');
CREATE TYPE QUARTER_TYPE AS ENUM ('Q1', 'Q2', 'Q3', 'Q4');

CREATE TABLE BUDGET6 (
	id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	year INT,           						-- eg. 2023
	quarter QUARTER_TYPE,       -- Null if it corresponds to the entire year     	
	category VARCHAR(128) NOT NULL,     		-- e.g., "Net Sales", "Gross Margin"
	parent_category VARCHAR(128),            	-- e.g., "Revenues Total", NULL for main categories
	value float8,                   	-- Financial values
	is_percentage BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,     	-- True for percentage rows
	value_type VALUE_TYPE DEFAULT 'REALIZED', -- 'REALIZED', 'ESTIMATED', 'FORECAST', 'BUDGETED'
	org_id ORG_ID_TYPE DEFAULT 'MWC'
);

# Guidelines
## Avaliable periods
2023, None, REALIZED
2024, "Q1", REALIZED
2024, "Q2", REALIZED
2024, "Q1", ESTIMATED
2024, "Q2", ESTIMATED
2024, "Q3", ESTIMATED
2024, None, ESTIMATED
2024, None, BUDGETED
2025, None, REALIZED
2025, None, BUDGETED
So including value_type will be necessary sometimes.

## Category distinct fields
Outsourced Employees Expenses Included in Personnel
Commercial GM%
Management Commission
Office Exp.& Maintenance
Expenses w/o Prov. Management &  Tax
Transport & Car repairs
Financial cost on lease liabilities
Non-Operating Revenues
Entertainment
Stock deterioration
Total Sales
Warranty and maintenance for BG
Hardware & Software Mainten.
Expenses / Revenues %
Net Income before provisions
Audit Fees
Tuition Fees
Top Up Tax (TUT)
Sundries
Consulting Fees & Commissions
Total Expenses
Sponsor Fees
Income Taxes (Including the TUT)
Vacation-Air Tickets
Participation Revenue
EBT
Foreigners Employees Included in Personnel
%GM
Accounting Charges
Sold Fixed Assets/Exceptional
Local Employees Included in Personnel
Transportation Allowance
Revenues Total
Attorney Fees
Training & Seminars
Apartments Allowances
After Sales Local
Expenses w/o Mgt & Tax Variation % between YOY
Expenses w/o Mgt & Tax/ GM %
Net Income / HC
Sales Local
Income Taxes
Localization
Total Administrative
Other Provision
Total Outsourcing
Management Fees
Telephone Telex Fax & Courier
Cost of Sales
Net Sales
Rent Office ,Warehouse & Cars/ Right of use
ITQAN Program Contribution to personnel Expenses (KSA)
Total Revenues / HC
Personnel Expenses
Commissions & Bonus
Other Allowance
Discounts covered by BDF Program
Gifts & Promotional Items
Legal Fees & Taxes (Incl. WHT)
Human Resources (Inc. local program Emp.)
Human Resources (Excl. local program Emp.)
Net Income in US$
Total Professional Services
Sub-Total Locals
Marketing Contribution
After Sales
Exchange Income
Bad Debts & Provisions
Financial Expenses
Expenses / GM %
ITQAN program Employees Included in Personnel (KSA)
Bonus & Commission / GM %
Impairment of Goodwill
Tools, Spare parts & Repair
Sales commission to other
Exceptional Loss
Outsourcing Local
Factoring
Certification
Subscription & Magazines
Operating & Administ. Expenses
Insurance Office & Cars
Medical Insurance
Net Income / Revenues %
Operating Revenues
Net Marketing
Freight Clearing & Customs
Head office expenses
HC Recharged by Affiliates
Outsourcing/Inside Sales
Administrative Local
EBIT
ECL for Banks
Sub-Total Foreigners
Exchange Expenses
Trading Portfolio Loss
Printing & Stationary
Gross Margin
Salaries
Penality Charges
End of Service Indemnity
Professional Services Local
Expenses w/o Prov. ,Mgt, tax & Outsourced included Personnel Exp
Advance Billing Provision
Electricity & Water
Sales
Financial Revenues & Cash Discount
Amortization & Depreciation
Tender fees
Outsourced Employees Expenses Allocated to COS
Total After Sales
Social Security
HC Recharged to Affiliates
Exhibition & Advertis.Expenses
Prof. Services
Administrative
Travel Expenses

From the list, the most relevant fields to extract conclusions usually are:
'Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$'
So extract them if asked.

# Examples
1. Query: "Give me the 24/B-24 ratio in percentage for 2024 for the business MWC"
Expected response:

sql: "SELECT 
	a.category, a.parent_category
    CASE
        WHEN b.value <> 0 THEN (a.value / b.value) * 100
        ELSE NULL
    END AS 24/B-24
FROM 
    budget6 a
JOIN 
    budget6 b
ON 
    a.categoryname = b.categoryname and a.quarterlabel is null and b.quarterlabel is null
WHERE 
    a.period = '2024' AND
    b.period = '2024' AND
    a.valuetype = 'ESTIMATED' AND
    b.valuetype = 'BUDGETED';"
short_description: "Estimated 2024/Budgeted 2024 ratio in percentage for MWC"
2. Query: "Give me for the most relevant values the B.2025 - Est2024 for MWC"
sql: "SELECT 
    a.category, 
    CASE
        WHEN b.value IS NOT NULL AND b.value <> 0 THEN (a.value - b.value)
        ELSE NULL
    END AS "B.2025 - Est2024"
FROM 
    budget6 a
JOIN 
    budget6 b
ON 
    a.category = b.category AND a.quarter IS NULL AND b.quarter IS NULL
WHERE 
    a.year = 2025 AND
    b.year = 2024 AND
    a.value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND
    b.value_type = 'ESTIMATED' AND
    a.org_id = 'MWC' AND
    b.org_id = 'MWC' AND
    a.category IN ('Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$');"
short_description: "B.2025 - Est2024 for key financial categories for MWC."
3. Query: "Give me only the relevant figures for the budget 2024 and budget 2025 and interpret them as a financial expert"
sql: SELECT year, category, parent_category, value, value_type FROM budget6 WHERE quarter is null and year IN (2024, 2025) AND value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND org_id = 'MWC' AND category IN ('Revenues Total', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Gross Margin', 'Personnel Expenses', 'Operating & Administ. Expenses', 'Income Taxes (Including the TUT)', 'Total Expenses', 'Net Income in US$');
short_description: "Budgeted values for 2024 and 2025 for key categories for MWC"

3. Query: "Give me a breakdown of the Personnel expenses of budget 2024 in MWC"
sql: SELECT category, parent_category, value 
	FROM budget6 
	WHERE 
	year = 2024 AND 
	quarter IS NULL AND 
	value_type = 'BUDGETED' AND 
	org_id = 'MWC' 
	AND (category = 'Personnel Expenses' or parent_category = 'Personnel Expenses');
short_description: "Breakdown of Personnel Expenses for budget 2024 in MWC and Personnel Espenses Total"

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langflow.field_typing.range_spec import RangeSpec
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from langflow.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from langflow.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from langflow.field_typing import LanguageModel
from langflow.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
            range_spec=RangeSpec(min=0, max=128000),
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature if temperature is not None else 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

from langflow.base.io.text import TextComponent
from langflow.io import MultilineInput, Output, DataInput
from langflow.schema.message import Message
import psycopg2
from tabulate import tabulate  # For generating Markdown tables
from langflow.schema import Data
print("hi")
class TextInputComponent(Component):
    display_name = "SQL Retriever"
    description = "SQL Retriever"
    icon = "database"
    name = "SQL Retriever"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="host", display_name="Host"),
        MessageTextInput(name="user", display_name="User"),
        MessageTextInput(name="sql_query", display_name="SQL Query"),
        MessageTextInput(name="short_description", display_name="Short Description", value=""),
        SecretStrInput(name="password", display_name="Password"),
        MessageTextInput(name="database", display_name="Database"),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            connection = psycopg2.connect(
                host=self.host, # "dev-maind.cnkw2weg8a5t.eu-west-1.rds.amazonaws.com",
                user=self.user, # postgres
                password=self.password, # "maind|159074-{RDS}",
                database=self.database #Â "MIDIS"
            )
            cursor = connection.cursor()

            print(str(self.sql_query))
            # Execute the query
            cursor.execute(
                str(self.sql_query)
            )
            result = cursor.fetchall()
    
            # Dynamically fetch headers
            headers = [desc[0] for desc in cursor.description]
            print(headers)
    
            # Generate Markdown table
            markdown_table = tabulate(result, headers, tablefmt="pipe", disable_numparse=True)
    
            # Clean up resources
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()
            print(result)
            print(markdown_table)
            final_string = f"{str(self.short_description)}\n{markdown_table}"
            self.status = final_string
            return Message(text=final_string)
        except Exception as e:
            return Message(text="Error retrieving data")
